inclusion.criterion: Adults with age of 20 years old or above
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients with symptoms of unpleasant sensation (pain, pressure, discomfort) perceived to be related to the urinary bladder
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: associated with lower urinary tract symptoms of more than six months duration
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: in the absence of infection or other identifiable causes
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patients has received cystoscopy and ruled out other bladder lesion
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Free of active urinary tract infection
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: Free of bladder outlet obstruction on enrollment
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Free of overt neurogenic bladder dysfunction and limitation of ambulation
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient or his/her legally acceptable representative has signed the written informed consent form
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Patients had received intravesical hyaluronic acid treatment in recent 3 months, or intravesical Botox injection in recent 12 months
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients with severe cardiopulmonary disease and such as congestive heart failure, arrhythmia, poorly controlled hypertension, not able to receive regular follow-up
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with bladder outlet obstruction on enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients with uncontrolled confirmed diagnosis of acute urinary tract infection
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Patients have laboratory abnormalities at screening including: alanine aminotransferase (ALT)> 3 x upper limit of normal range, and aspartate aminotransferase (AST) > 3 x upper limit of normal range
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients have abnormal serum creatinine level > 2 x upper limit of normal range
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Female patients who is pregnant, lactating, or with child-bearing potential without contraception
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: 62 yo male with hx of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter with multiple prior admissions for UTIs, altered mental status, and urosepsis presents to the hospital in urosepsis now resolved after treatment with vanc/meropenem. Per CT there is a non-obstructing stone in the L ureter, no evidence of urethral strictures. Significant leaking around suprapubic cath site. Started on ditropan changed over to detrol. Urologist not concerned with leaking and will f/u with pt next week.
